required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chemoradiotherapy Plus Immunotherapy Followed by Surgery for Esophageal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Neoadjuvant Chemoradiotherapy Plus Tislelizumab Followed by Surgery for Thoracic Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer: A Prospective, Single Arm, Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy is recommended as standard therapy for resectable esophageal cancer. The recurrence rate after surgery following neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy is about 35%. Whether achieving pathological complete response after neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy is significantly associated with recurrence after surgery. It is reported that immunotherapy combined with chemotherapy improved survival compared with chemotherapy alone in first line therapy of advanced esophageal cancer. We hypothesize that the addition of immunotherapy to neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy is helpful to improving pathologic complete response and survival.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years after first medication of Tislelizumab
2 years after first medication of Tislelizumab

arm_group.description: Radiotherapy: PTV 41.4Gy in 23 Fractions，5 days per week; Chemotherapy: Paclitaxel (Albumin bound) (100mg per square meter of body-surface area weekly) and Caboplatin (area under the curve of 2 mg per milliliter per minute weekly) for 5 weeks, concurrent with radiotherapy; Immunotherapy: Tislelizumab (200mg per 3 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Pathologically diagnosed as esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
- Initially diagnosed as thoracic esophageal cancer
- resectable or potantially resectable
- II-IVA according to AJCC 8th edition；
- KPS≥70
- Adequate organ function
